summary: This mod adds a complete forge and crafting room at the Dwemer War Quarters in Blackreach.
descriptionHtml:
[font=Georgia][color=#ff7700][size=4]

I present to you the Forgemasters Warforge, an ancient Dwemer forge located in the depth of Blackreach...

[/size][/color][/font][color=#ffd966]This is a very small mod and hate to use that phrase, but I really did make this for my own convenience and share it with the community in case others like to hang out in Blackreach...

This is really for people who like I said love to spend time in Blackreach or even start a Character in Blackreach via an alternate start mod. I did just that and found the lack of crafting stations very irritating and also nonsensical; you would think that all that metal forged technology of the Dwemer and there would be some remnant of a forge where they actually build the damned things and made their heavy armor.
The so called "War Quarters" in Blackreach are actually disappointingly empty and offered a logical location for a forge and processing center for ore; so that is what I did and I tried to adapt vanilla crafting stations to look and feel like something the Dwemer might have used.
The only piece that I did not adapt as such is a tanning rack, but there was some evidence of prior adventurer activity in there (candle placed on a rock ledge) and so I made it look like that is left from an adventurer. There is a knapsack and it is safe for storage!
The GS version has a simple crafting supplies activator in addition.

I hope you find this a useful addition to your game and enjoy discovering it. There are two complete sets of Dwemer armor around the crafting stations, one plain and the other enchanted at a high level; there are also several plain and enchanted Dwemer weapons about the forge and a bunch of raw material.

COMPATIBILITY:Â 
The only other mod I know of that uses this space is 3DNPC (Interesting NPCs) and my mod is fully compatible with it; the two mods occupy different areas of the War Quarters.

INSTALLATION:
Install with your favorite MO and activate in your load order; no DLC required. For the GS version [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/18340/?]General Stores[/url] is obviously required.

This mod has been cleaned with TES5Edit; load order does not matter but I recommend you run LOOT after installing it anyway.

CREDIT:
Thanks to Bethesda for this awesome game and the tools to mod it.
[/color]
author: Kursan
